<B><FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=5><P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">Executive Service Agreement</P>
</FONT><FONT FACE="Arial"><P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">Coles Myer Ltd</P>
</B><P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">ABN 11 004 089 936</P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">and</P>
<B><P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">Dawn Robertson</P>
</FONT><FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=5><P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">This executive service agreement</P><DIR>
<DIR>
<DIR>
<DIR>

</B></FONT><P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">is made on 4 April 2002 between the following parties:</P><DIR>
<DIR>

<B><P>1.&#9;Coles Myer Ltd<BR>
</B>ABN 11 004 089 936<BR>
of 800 Toorak Road, </P>
<B><P>&#9;</B>Tooronga, Victoria 3146</P>
<P>Australia</P>
<P>&#9;(<B>the Company</B>)</P>
<B><P>2.&#9;Dawn Robertson</P>
</B><P>&#9;43 Deepwoods Lane,</P><DIR>
<DIR>

<P>Old Greenwich, CT 06870</P>
<P>United States of America</P></DIR>
</DIR>

<I><P>&#9;</I>(<B>the Executive</B>)</P></DIR>
</DIR>
</DIR>
</DIR>
</DIR>
</DIR>

<B><FONT FACE="Arial"><P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">Recitals</P>
</B></FONT><P>The Company has agreed to employ the Executive and the Executive has agreed to accept appointment as Managing Director, Myer Grace Bros, on the terms of this agreement effective from 1 June 2002.</P>
<P>The Executive has requested that the benefits provided under this agreement be given as consideration for her agreeing to be employed as Managing Director, Myer Grace Bros.</P>
<B><FONT FACE="Arial"><P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">The parties agree</P><DIR>
<DIR>
<DIR>
<DIR>

</B></FONT><P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">in consideration of the mutual promises contained in this agreement:</P></DIR>
</DIR>
</DIR>
</DIR>

<OL>

<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI><A NAME="_Toc436019920"><A NAME="_Toc398005813"><A NAME="_Toc397426129"><B><FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=4>Definitions and interpretation</A></A></A></LI></P>
<OL>

<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI><A NAME="_Toc436019921"><A NAME="_Toc398005814"><A NAME="_Toc397426130"></FONT><FONT FACE="Arial">Definitions</A></A></A></LI></P>
</B></FONT><P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">In this agreement:</P>
<B><P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">Base Salary</B> means the salary specified in clause 5.2 of this agreement.</P>
<B><P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">Board</B> means the Board of Directors of the Company.</P>
<B><P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">board or managerial office</B> means the same as it does in section 9 of the Corporations Act.</P>
<B><P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">Business Day </B>means a day on which trading banks are open for business in Victoria, other than a Saturday, Sunday or a public holiday.</P>
<B><P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">Cause</B> means -</P>
<OL TYPE="a">

<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI>&#9;becoming bankrupt or suspending payment or compounding with or assigning her estate for the benefit of her creditors;</LI></P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI>&#9;becoming of unsound mind or a person whose person or estate is liable to be dealt with under any law relating to mental health;</LI></P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI>&#9;failing to remedy a serious or persistent breach of this agreement within 14 days of receiving from the Company<B> </B>a written notice specifying the breach and requiring the Executive to remedy it;</LI></P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI>&#9;wilful commission by the Executive of any act involving dishonesty or fraud; or</LI></P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI>&#9;gross misconduct in the performance of the duty of the Executive to any Group Company that causes injury or is likely to cause injury to the Group or any Group Company.</LI></P></OL>

<B><P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">Group</B> means the Company and all Group Companies.</P>
<B><P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">Group Company</B> at a given time means a body corporate that is a "related body corporate" (as that expression is defined in the Corporations Act) of the Company at that time.</P>
<B><P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">Option Plan </B>means the Coles Myer Ltd Executive Option Plan 2002 - Senior Executives.</P>
<B><P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">Share</B> means a fully paid ordinary share in the capital of the Company.</P>
<B><P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">Termination Date</B> means the date the Executive ceases to be employed by the Company.</P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI><A NAME="_Toc436019922"><A NAME="_Toc398005815"><A NAME="_Toc397426131"><B><FONT FACE="Arial">Interpretation</A></A></A></LI></P>
</B></FONT><P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">In this agreement, headings are for convenience only and do not affect the interpretation of this agreement and, unless the context otherwise requires: </P>
<OL TYPE="a">

<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI>&#9;a reference to termination of this agreement includes a reference to termination of the Executive's contract of employment;</LI></P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI>&#9;words importing the singular include the plural and vice versa; </LI></P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI>&#9;words importing a gender include any gender;</LI></P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI>&#9;other parts of speech and grammatical forms of a word or phrase defined in this agreement have a corresponding meaning;</LI></P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI><A NAME="_Ref394747556">&#9;a reference to any thing (including, but not limited to, any right) includes a part of that thing but nothing in this clause 1.2(e) implies that performance of part of an obligation constitutes performance of the obligation;</A></LI></P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI>&#9;a reference to a party to a document includes that party's successors and permitted assigns;</LI></P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI>&#9;a reference to a statute, regulation, proclamation, ordinance or by-law includes all statutes, regulations, proclamations, ordinances or by-laws varying, consolidating or replacing it, and a reference to a statute includes all regulations, proclamations, ordinances and by-laws issued under that statute; </LI></P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI>&#9;a reference to a document or agreement includes all amendments or supplements to, or replacements or novations of, that document or agreement; and</LI></P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI>&#9;terms defined in the Option Plan rules have the same meaning in this agreement.</LI></P></OL>
</OL>

<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">&nbsp;</P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI><A NAME="_Toc436019923"><A NAME="_Toc398005816"><A NAME="_Toc397426132"><B><FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=4>Appointment</A></A></A></LI></P>
<OL>

</B></FONT><P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI>The Company appoints the Executive as its Managing Director, Myer Grace Bros and the Executive accepts that appointment as from 1 June 2002<FONT FACE="Arial">.</LI></P>
</FONT><P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI>The Company acknowledges and agrees that the benefits provided under this agreement and otherwise given in relation to her appointment are in consideration for the Executive agreeing to hold the position of Managing Director, Myer Grace Bros and any other board or managerial office and as such constitute an exempt benefit under section 200F of the Corporations Act.<B><FONT FACE="Arial"> </LI></P>
</B></FONT><P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI>The Executive will be based in Melbourne but will be expected to travel on Company business to interstate and overseas locations. Any travel overseas for Company business purposes requires prior approval of the Company as to duration and timing.</LI></P></OL>

<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI><A NAME="_Toc436019924"><A NAME="_Toc398005817"><A NAME="_Toc397426133"><B><FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=4>Term</A></A></A></LI></P>
</B></FONT><P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">The appointment of the Executive pursuant to clause 2 will continue until terminated by either party in accordance with the terms set out in this agreement.</P>
<B><FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=4><P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI>Responsibility</LI></P>
<OL>

</B></FONT><P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI>The Executive will:</LI></P>
<OL TYPE="a">

<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI>&#9;exercise the powers and perform the duties appropriate to her appointment as Managing Director, Myer Grace Bros and in all respects comply with the lawful directions given to her by the Company; and</LI></P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI>&#9;well and faithfully serve the Group and use her best endeavours to promote its interests and welfare.</LI></P></OL>
</OL>

<B><P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">4.2</B>&#9;While the Executive is employed by the Company, the Executive must not be engaged, concerned or interested in any other business or hold any office or accept any appointment to serve on any board of directors without the prior written consent of the Chief Executive Officer and the Board, such consent not to be unreasonably withheld.</P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">&#9;For the purposes of clarity, the Executive is not prevented from:</P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">(a)&#9;holding shares in companies listed on any recognised stock exchange;</P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">(b)&#9;holding office as a director or trustee of any private family company or trust;</P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">(c)&#9;being involved in any cultural or civic organisations; or</P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">(d)&#9;with the approval of the Chief Executive Officer, engaging in any reasonable involvement in any professional body;</P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">where any such office or involvement does not detract from the Executive's performance of her duties to the Company.</P>
<B><FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=4><P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI>Remuneration</LI></P>
<OL>

<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI><A NAME="_Toc436019929"><A NAME="_Toc398005822"><A NAME="_Toc397426138"></FONT><FONT FACE="Arial">Base </A></A></A>Salary</LI></P>
</B></FONT><P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">During the period that the Executive serves the Company under this agreement, the Company will pay the Executive the Base Salary, determined under this clause 5, by approximately equal monthly instalments, or as otherwise agreed between the parties.</P>
<B><FONT FACE="Arial"><P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI>Base Salary</LI></P>
</B></FONT><P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">The Base Salary for the period from the Executive's appointment is US$700,000 (gross) per annum. The Base Salary will be reviewed annually as part of the Company's Remuneration Policy. The Base Salary will not be reduced as a consequence of a review or otherwise. If the Base Salary is increased at any review, the increase will not be off-set against any other payments and/or benefits provided to the Executive under this agreement.</P>
<B><FONT FACE="Arial"><P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI>Additional salary</LI></P>
<OL TYPE="a">

</B></FONT><P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI>&#9;During the period that the Executive serves the Company under this agreement, the Company will pay the Executive additional salary of up to eighty percent (80%) of the Base Salary as given in clause 5.2 and which may be increased from time to time, payable by 15 November following the end of each Company financial year.</LI></P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI>&#9;The Company will pay in respect of the 2002 Company financial year US$185,000 (gross).</LI></P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI>&#9;The amount payable in each year following the 2002 Company financial year will be determined by satisfaction of key performance indicators. The Company will determine the key performance indicators for each Company financial year in or about July each year, in consultation with the Executive.</LI></P></OL>

<B><FONT FACE="Arial"><P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI>Other Benefits</LI></P>
</B></FONT><P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">In addition to the Base Salary, the Executive will also be entitled to:</P>
<OL TYPE="a">

<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI>&#9;A relocation package by way of:</LI></P>
<OL>

<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI>payment or reimbursement of the out of pocket documented cost of moving to and from Australia, including moving or storing and insuring furniture and personal effects. The package is to include the cost of business class airfares to Australia and back to the United States of America (upon the termination of the Executive's employment with the Company) for the Executive and any immediate family residing with her at the time of travel and one additional business return airfare for a domestic support person; </LI></P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI>paid membership of a private Australian Health Fund for the Executive and any immediate family residing in Australia during the term of employment;</LI></P></OL>

<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">(3)&#9;an allowance for reimbursement of taxation advice expenses of up to AUD $5,500 each year;</P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">(4)&#9;reimbursement of any United States motor vehicle lease cancellation fees and school tuition cancellation fees; and </P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">(5)&#9;Life and disability insurance which provides for a maximum payment of AUD $3,750,000 in the event of the Executive's death.</P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI>Payment of:</LI></P>
<OL>

<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI>legal costs, fees and disbursements;</LI></P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI>real estate agent's fees;</LI></P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI>mortgage pre-payment penalty fees; and</LI></P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI>city and State tax stamps fees</LI></P></OL>

<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">&#9;&#9;associated with the sale of the Executive's residential property in the United States of America and the legal, real estate and stamp duty costs associated with the purchase of a residential property in Australia. </P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI>Provision of the use of two motor vehicles for the Executive and her spouse including all maintenance, registration, insurance, fuel and running costs up to an amount of AUD $100,000 inclusive of any taxation cost to the Company, for each year of service.</LI></P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI>&#9;Payment of the cost of a total of two return business class airline fares for the Executive and any family residing in Australia to the United States of America each year for use by the Executive and her family, plus one additional return business class airfare to the United States of America for the Executive's spouse.</LI></P></OL>

<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">&#9;Except for the benefit in (c), payments of the above benefits will be made on presentation of invoices or, if applicable, tax invoices for GST purposes.</P>
<B><FONT FACE="Arial"><P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI>Tax on Other Benefits</LI></P>
</B></FONT><P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">If for any reason a payment made by the Company under clause 5.4 of this agreement is or will be treated as assessable income of the Executive under any Australian law relating to tax, the Company will pay to the Executive an additional amount so that, after withholding or deducting from that amount all tax paid or payable in respect of the payment and the additional amount, the balance remaining is equal to the amount of the payment.</P>
<B><FONT FACE="Arial"><P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI>Other payments</LI></P>
</B></FONT><P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">&#9;Subject to clause 5.7, on the dates specified below ("the payment dates") the Executive will be paid the following special payments provided the Executive is in the continued full time service of the Company:</P>
<OL TYPE="a">

<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI>US$45,220 (gross) payable on commencement of this agreement in recognition of the 2003 long term bonus potential forfeited by the Executive upon her resignation from Federated Department Stores ; </LI></P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI>US$700,000 (gross) payable on the dates listed below in recognition of the retention bonus due to the Executive from Federated Department Stores in April 2003:</LI></P>
<OL>

<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI>as to US$350,000, on 1 June 2002; and</LI></P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI>as to US$350,000, on 1 June 2003,</LI></P></OL>

<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">and</P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI>US$500,000 (gross) payable on the dates listed below:</LI></P>
<OL>

<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI>as to US$300,000, on 1 June 2005; and</LI></P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI>as to US$200,000, on 1 June 2007.</LI></P></OL>
</OL>

<B><FONT FACE="Arial"><P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI>Payment of special payments on termination</LI></P></OL>

</B></FONT><P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">If the Executive's employment is terminated under clause 11.1(a) or 11.1(e) before any of the payment dates specified in clause 5.6, within 30 days of the Termination Date, the Company will pay the Executive those special payments which have not been paid but which would have been paid had the Executive continued in full time employment until 1 June 2005.</P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">&nbsp;</P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI><A NAME="_Toc436019935"><A NAME="_Toc398005828"><A NAME="_Toc397426144"><A NAME="_Ref397425608"><A NAME="_Ref397425313"><B><FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=4>Superannuation</A></A></A></A></A> <A NAME="_Toc436019936"><A NAME="_Toc398005829"><A NAME="_Toc397426145"><A NAME="_Ref394749026"><A NAME="_Ref394748958"><A NAME="_Ref394748880">contributions</A></A></A></A></A></A></LI></P>
</B></FONT><P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">&#9;The Company will make superannuation contributions in accordance with the superannuation guarantee charge legislation for the benefit of the Executive to the Coles Myer Superannuation Fund Accumulation Section provided that:</P><OL START=0>

<OL TYPE="a">

<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI>the Executive may apply for an exemption for the Company from having to make superannuation contributions for the benefit of the Executive under the superannuation guarantee charge legislation; and</LI></P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI>in the event that such an exemption is obtained, the Company shall not make any such contributions.</LI></P></OL>
</OL>

<B><FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=4><P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI>Share options</LI></P>
<OL>

</B></FONT><P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI>The Executive is offered 2.5 million Options under the Option Plan. The Options will:</LI></P>
<OL TYPE="a">

<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI>have an exercise price of AUD $7.66;</LI></P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI>have an Initial Test FY of the financial year of the Company commencing 30 July 2001, notwithstanding the definition of Initial Test FY in the Option Plan.</LI></P></OL>

<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI>This clause is deemed to be the Offer Letter with respect to the Options referred to in clause 7.1. By signing this agreement the Executive accepts the offer of Options set out in clause 7.1 and agrees to be bound by the Option Plan rules.</LI></P></OL>

<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI><A NAME="_Toc436019944"><A NAME="_Toc398005837"><A NAME="_Toc397426153"><B><FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=4>Expenses </A></A></A></LI></P>
</B></FONT><P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">The Company will reimburse the Executive for reasonable out-of-pocket expenses incurred by the Executive on the business of the Company upon receipt of monthly expense reports and receipts, and, where applicable, tax invoices for GST purposes.</P>
<B><FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=4><P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI>Leave Entitlements</LI></P>
<OL>

</B></FONT><P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI>The Executive is entitled to public holidays and long service leave in conformity with statutory entitlements and 20 working days annual leave per annum or such greater period as approved by the Company </LI></P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI>The Executive must take annual leave at a period or periods agreed between the Company and Executive.</LI></P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI>The Company does not apply a formal sick leave policy to senior executives, preferring to deal with absences on a case by case basis.</LI></P></OL>

<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI><A NAME="_Toc436019955"><A NAME="_Toc398005848"><A NAME="_Toc397426164"><A NAME="_Ref394748343"><B><FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=4>Confidentiality</A></A></A></A> and restrictions</LI></P>
<OL>

<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI><A NAME="_Toc436019956"><A NAME="_Toc398005849"><A NAME="_Toc397426165"><A NAME="_Ref394748339"></FONT><FONT FACE="Arial">Executive's obligations</A></A></A></A> of confidence</LI></P>
<OL TYPE="a">

</B></FONT><P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI>&#9;Unless required by the Company or by law the Executive must:</LI></P>
<OL>

<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI>keep any Information secret and confidential;</LI></P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI>take all reasonable and necessary precautions to maintain the secrecy and prevent the disclosure of any Information; and</LI></P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI>not disclose Information to any third party without first obtaining the written consent of the Company<B> </B>except in the ordinary and proper course of employment with the Company.</LI></P></OL>

<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI><A NAME="_Toc436019957"><A NAME="_Toc398005850"><A NAME="_Toc397426166">&#9;In this clause, <B>Information</B> means any information in respect of the Company's business which is not in the public domain and includes, but is not limited to, any document, book, account, process, patent, specification, drawing, design or know-how which:</LI></P>
<OL>

<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI>comes to the notice of the Executive in the course of the Executive's employment; or</LI></P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI>is generated by the Executive in the course of performing the Executive's obligations.</LI></P></OL>
</OL>

<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">&nbsp;</P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI><A NAME="_Toc436019959"><A NAME="_Toc398005852"><A NAME="_Toc397426168"><A NAME="_Ref394748647"><A NAME="_Ref394748251"><A NAME="_Ref394748208"></A></A></A><B><FONT FACE="Arial">Restricted activities</A></A></A></A></A></A></LI></P>
</B></FONT><P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><A NAME="_Ref394748212">&#9;The Executive must not during employment under this agreement or at any time within the period of twelve months after the Termination Date, without the prior written consent of the Company:</A></P>
<OL TYPE="a">

<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI>&#9;induce or attempt to induce any director, manager or employee of the Company to terminate his or her employment with the Group, whether or not that person would commit a breach of that person's contract of employment;</LI></P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI>&#9;employ or engage in any capacity any person who has been a director, manager, employee of or consultant to the Group during the previous twelve months of the Executive's employment who is or may be likely to be in possession of any confidential information or trade secrets relating to the business of the Group; and</LI></P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI><A NAME="_Ref394748262">&#9;solicit or persuade any person who has dealt with the Group during the previous twelve months of the Executive's employment or is in the process of negotiating with the Company at the Termination Date, to cease doing business with the Company or reduce the amount of business which the person would normally do with the Group</A>.</LI></P></OL>

<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI><A NAME="_Toc436019960"><A NAME="_Toc398005853"><A NAME="_Toc397426169"><B><FONT FACE="Arial">Restraints</LI></P>
</B></FONT><P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">&#9;The Executive must not during employment under this agreement or, during any period for which payment in lieu of notice is made but in any event for not less than twelve months after the Termination Date, without the prior written consent of the Company, be concerned in Australia in any general merchandise or apparel retailing business with sales turnover of greater than AUD $1 billion which operates in direct or indirect competition with the Company or a Group Company in Australia, whether solely or as a partner, agent, shareholder, adviser, consultant, officer or employee of any person, firm or corporation. </P>
<B><FONT FACE="Arial"><P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI>Restraints reasonable</A></A></A></LI></P>
<OL TYPE="a">

</B></FONT><P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI>&#9;The Executive and the Company consider the restraints contained in this clause to be reasonable and intend the restraints to operate to the maximum extent.</LI></P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI>&#9;If these restraints:</LI></P>
<OL>

<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI>are void as unreasonable for the protection of the interests of the Company; and </LI></P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI>would be valid if part of the wording was deleted or the period or area was reduced, </LI></P></OL>
</OL>

<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">&#9;the restraints will apply with the modifications necessary to make them effective.</P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">&nbsp;</P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI><A NAME="_Toc436019961"><A NAME="_Toc398005854"><A NAME="_Toc397426170"><B><FONT FACE="Arial">Restraints independent</A></A></A></LI></P>
</B></FONT><P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">&#9;The restraints contained in this clause are separate, distinct and several, so that the unenforceability of any restraint does not affect the enforceability of the other restraints.</P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI><A NAME="_Toc436019962"><A NAME="_Toc398005855"><A NAME="_Toc397426171"><A NAME="_Ref394748359"><B><FONT FACE="Arial">Acknowledgments by Executive</A></A></A></A></LI></P>
</B></FONT><P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">&#9;The Executive acknowledges that:</P>
<OL TYPE="a">

<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI>the Executive will obtain Information concerning the business and finances of the Company and Group Companies including trade secrets and industrial processes;</LI></P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI>disclosure of Information could materially harm the Company; </LI></P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI>the restrictive covenants contained in this clause are reasonable and necessary for the protection of the goodwill of the Company;</LI></P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI>the remedy of damages may be inadequate to protect the interests of the Company and the Company is entitled to seek and obtain injunctive relief, or any other remedy, in any Court; and</LI></P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI>this clause will survive the termination of the Executive's employment with the Company in all circumstances including repudiation by the Company of the remainder of this agreement.<A NAME="_Toc436019968"><A NAME="_Toc398005861"><A NAME="_Toc397426177"><A NAME="_Ref394748562"><A NAME="_Ref394748502"></LI></P></OL>
</OL>

<B><FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=4><P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI>Termination</A></A></A></A></A></LI></P>
<OL>

<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI><A NAME="_Toc436019969"><A NAME="_Toc398005862"><A NAME="_Toc397426178"></FONT><FONT FACE="Arial">Termination by the Company</LI></P>
<OL TYPE="a">

</B></FONT><P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI>The Company may terminate this agreement by giving the Executive:</LI></P>
<OL>

<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI>at any time prior to the expiration of three years after her appointment twelve months' written notice or payment in lieu of notice in addition to a payment equal to twelve months remuneration; or</LI></P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI>at any time thereafter twelve months' written notice or payment in lieu of notice .</LI></P></OL>

<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI>In addition, on termination with notice or payment in lieu of notice, the Company will pay the Executive: </LI></P>
<OL>

<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI>an amount in respect of any accrued leave entitlements up to the date of termination;</LI></P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI>if not already paid, under clause 5.3(a):</LI></P>
<OL TYPE="A">

<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI>a payment in respect of the previous Company financial year provided key performance indicators have been met; and</LI></P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI>a pro rata payment for the current Company financial year calculated as follows,</LI></P></OL>

<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">A/B x C = pro rata payment</P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">Where:</P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">A = the number of business days which the Executive has worked in the current Company financial year;</P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">B = the number of business days in the current Company financial year; and</P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">C = the amount of additional salary paid to the Executive under clause 5.3(a) in the immediately previous Company financial year;</P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">and</P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI>if not already paid, the amounts referred to in clause 5.6 in accordance with clause 5.7. </LI></P></OL>

<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI>Payment in lieu of notice will be calculated as follows:</LI></P>
<OL>

<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI>if the Company elects to pay the Executive in lieu of the whole notice period<A NAME="Temp"></A>, such payment to be calculated on the basis of:</LI></P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">&#9;(A)&#9;annual Base Salary; and</P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">&#9;(B)&#9;payment of the pro rata value of the benefits contained in clause 5.4(c) and (d).</P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI>if the Company requires the Executive to work some but not all of the twelve month notice period (such period to be worked to be determined at the time that the Company notifies the Executive that she will be required to work for that part of the notice period) then the Executive will be paid an amount in respect of the part of the notice period not worked, such payment to be calculated on the basis of:</LI></P></OL>

<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">&#9;&#9;(A)&#9;pro rata annual Base Salary; and</P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">&#9;&#9;(B)&#9;payment of the pro rata value of the benefits contained in clause 5.4(c) and (d).</P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI>The Company may terminate this agreement immediately for Cause. Upon termination for Cause the Executive will not be entitled to any payments other than payments on account of pro rata Base Salary, the pro rata benefits contained in clauses 5.4(c) and (d) and any accrued leave entitlements up to the date of termination.</LI></P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI>The Company may terminate this agreement, if, at any time, in the reasonable opinion of an appropriately qualified medical health professional agreed between the Company and the Executive, the Executive becomes unable to perform her duties owing to her becoming totally incapacitated by ill health (mental or physical) or accident and, in the reasonable opinion of the Company determined in good faith, the incapacity has continued for a period of more than 3 consecutive months or for a period or periods aggregating more than 90 days in any 52 consecutive weeks. In these circumstances, at any time after the expiration of that period or those periods, the Company may terminate the Executive's employment by giving notice in writing with immediate effect. The Executive will be paid on termination:</LI></P>
<OL>

<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI>to the date of notice, payment of pro rata Base Salary;</LI></P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI>to the date of notice, payment of the pro rata value of the benefits contained in clause 5.4(c) and (d);</LI></P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI>if not already paid, under clause 5.3(a):</LI></P>
<OL TYPE="A">

<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI>a payment in respect of the previous Company financial year provided key performance indicators have been met; and</LI></P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI>a pro rata payment for the current Company financial year calculated as follows,</LI></P></OL>

<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">A/B x C = pro rata payment</P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">Where:</P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">A = the number of business days which the Executive has worked in the current Company financial year;</P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">B = the number of business days in the current Company financial year; and</P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">C = the amount of additional salary paid to the Executive under clause 5.3(a) in the immediately previous Company financial year; </P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">and</P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI>if not already paid, the amounts referred to in clause 5.6 in accordance with clause 5.7. </LI></P></OL>
</OL>

<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI></A></A></A><B><FONT FACE="Arial">Termination by Executive</LI></P>
</B></FONT><P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">The Executive may terminate this agreement by giving twelve months' written notice to the Company. The Company may at its discretion:</P>
<OL TYPE="a">

<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI>require the Executive to continue working through the notice period; or</LI></P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI>elect to make the termination effective immediately, in which case the Executive will be entitled on termination to:</LI></P>
<OL>

<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI>a payment in lieu of the whole twelve month notice period, such payment to be calculated on the basis of:</LI></P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">&#9;&#9;(A)&#9;annual Base Salary;</P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">&#9;(B)&#9;payment of the pro rata value of the benefits contained in clauses 5.4(c) and (d); or</P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI>require the Executive to work some but not all of the twelve month period (such period to be worked to be determined at the time that the Company notifies the Executive that she will be required to work for that part of the notice period) in which case the Executive will be entitled on termination to a payment in lieu of the unworked notice period, such payment to be calculated on the basis of:</LI></P></OL>
</OL>

<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">&#9;&#9;(A)&#9;pro-rata annual Base Salary; and</P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">&#9;(B)&#9;payment of the pro rata value of the benefits contained in clauses 5.4(c) and (d). </P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI><A NAME="_Toc436019971"><A NAME="_Toc398005864"><A NAME="_Toc397426180"><B><FONT FACE="Arial">Maximum payments</LI></P>
<OL TYPE="a">

</B></FONT><P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI>If the amount that would, but for this provision, be payable to the Executive:</LI></P>
<OL>

<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI>under this agreement in connection with retirement from board or managerial offices in the Company and its related bodies corporate; and</LI></P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI>the value of all other payments made in connection with such retirement; but</LI></P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI>excluding any benefits to which section 200F of the Corporations Act applies, </LI></P></OL>
</OL>

<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">exceeds the maximum amount that could, because she is a person retiring from such board and managerial offices, be paid to her under section 200G of the Corporations Act, the amount payable to the Executive under this agreement will be reduced so that the aggregate value of all benefits given, paid or payable to the Executive in connection with retirement (excluding any benefits to which section 200F applies) is equal to that maximum amount.</P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">(b)&#9;Expressions used in clause 11.3(a) have their meanings as in Division&nbsp;2 of Part 2D.2 of the Corporations Act.&#9;</A></A></A></P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI><A NAME="_Toc436019974"><A NAME="_Toc398005867"><A NAME="_Toc397426183"><B><FONT FACE="Arial">Obligations on termination</A></A></A></LI></P>
<OL TYPE="a">

</B></FONT><P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI>On termination of this agreement, the Executive must return to the Company all tangible property of the Company or any Group Company including, but not limited to, all books, documents, computers, papers, materials, credit cards, cars and keys held by the Executive or under the Executive's control. For the avoidance of doubt the Company acknowledges that personal names and address lists or indexes are not considered tangible property of the Company or any Group Company.</LI></P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI>If at the Termination Date the Executive is a director of any Group Company, the Executive will resign from those directorships. The Executive irrevocably appoints the Company Secretary of the Company or any other person nominated by the Company as her attorney to provide the Executive's resignation on her behalf as a director.</LI></P></OL>
</OL>

<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">&nbsp;</P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">(c)&#9;&#9;On termination of this agreement, the Company must pay the amounts due under this agreement within 30 days of the Termination Date or such other period as agreed between the Executive and the Company.</P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">&nbsp;</P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI><A NAME="_Toc436019976"><A NAME="_Toc398005869"><A NAME="_Toc397426185"><B><FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=4>Company policies</LI></P>
<OL>

</B></FONT><P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI>The Executive will abide by the Company policies on Equal Opportunity and Discrimination, Occupational Health and Safety and Email and Internet usage as varied from time to time. These policies do not, however, form part of the Executive's contract of employment.</LI></P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI>The Executive is required to read, sign and return with her acceptance of this agreement, the Conflict of Interest Declaration contained in the Coles Myer Code of Conduct booklet. The Executive is required to comply with the Coles Myer Code of Conduct.</LI></P></OL>

<B><FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=4><P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI>Taxes and other government levies</LI></P>
<OL>

</B></FONT><P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI>Except with respect to the specific GST and FBT provisions set out in this agreement, the Executive is liable for all taxes payable in relation to Base Salary, Additional Salary, Other Payments and Termination Payments under or as a consequence of this agreement whether in Australia, the United States of America or elsewhere.</LI></P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI>As and when required by Australian law, the Company will deduct from any payment due to the Executive under this agreement or by virtue of the issue of any Options:</LI></P>
<OL TYPE="a">

<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI>tax instalments in US dollars at the appropriate Australian tax rate for individuals plus any levies and remit those deductions to the Australian Commissioner of Taxation;</LI></P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI>Company contributions to superannuation required by law to be made; and</LI></P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI>any other deductions required under the laws of Australia.</LI></P></OL>
</OL>

<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI></A></A></A><B><FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=4>General</LI></P>
<OL>

<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI><A NAME="_Toc436019977"><A NAME="_Toc398005870"><A NAME="_Toc397426186"><A NAME="_Ref394748582"></FONT><FONT FACE="Arial">Notices</A></A></A></A></LI></P>
</B></FONT><P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><A NAME="_Ref394748585">Any notice or other communication to or by a party to this agreement:</A></P>
<OL TYPE="a">

<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI>must be in legible writing addressed to the Company's business, or the Executive's last notified residential address, or as specified to the sender by notice; and</LI></P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI><A NAME="_Ref394748589">is regarded as being given and received:</A></LI></P>
<OL>

<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI>if by delivery in person, when delivered to the addressee;</LI></P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI>if by post, two Business Days after the date of postage; or</LI></P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI>if by facsimile, when transmitted to the addressee.</LI></P></OL>
</OL>

<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI><A NAME="_Toc436019978"><A NAME="_Toc398005871"><A NAME="_Toc397426187"><B><FONT FACE="Arial">Governing law and jurisdiction</A></A></A></LI></P>
<OL TYPE="a">

</B></FONT><P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI>This agreement is governed by the laws of Victoria.</LI></P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI>The parties irrevocably submit to the exclusive jurisdiction of the courts of Victoria.</LI></P></OL>

<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI><A NAME="_Toc436019979"><A NAME="_Toc398005872"><A NAME="_Toc397426188"><B><FONT FACE="Arial">Prohibition, enforceability and severance</A></A></A></LI></P>
<OL TYPE="a">

</B></FONT><P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI>Any provision of, or the application of any provision of, this agreement which is prohibited in any jurisdiction is, in that jurisdiction, ineffective only to the extent of that prohibition.</LI></P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI>Any provision of, or the application of any provision of, this agreement which is void, illegal or unenforceable in any jurisdiction does not affect the validity, legality or enforceability of that provision in any other jurisdiction or of the remaining provisions in that or any other jurisdiction.</LI></P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI>If a clause is void, illegal or unenforceable, it may be severed without affecting the enforceability of the other provisions in this agreement.</LI></P></OL>

<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI><A NAME="_Toc436019980"><A NAME="_Toc398005873"><A NAME="_Toc397426189"><B><FONT FACE="Arial">Waiver</A></A></A></LI></P>
<OL TYPE="a">

</B></FONT><P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI>The failure of either party at any time to require performance by the other party of any provision of this agreement does not affect the party's right to require the performance at any time.</LI></P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI>The waiver by either party of a breach of any provision must not be held to be a waiver of any succeeding breach of the provision or a waiver of the provision itself.</LI></P></OL>

<B><FONT FACE="Arial"><P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI>Confidentiality of this agreement</LI></P>
</B></FONT><P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">The parties agree that the terms of this agreement are strictly confidential and may not be disclosed by either party, except:</P>
<OL TYPE="a">

<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI>where required to be disclosed by compulsion of law, pursuant to the provisions of the Corporations Act or other applicable legislation or the listing rules of a recognised stock exchange upon which Company's shares are quoted; or</LI></P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI>to legal, taxation or other advisers; or</LI></P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI>by the Executive to members of her immediate family. </LI></P></OL>
</OL>

<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">Where either party may be required to disclose details relating to this agreement, the parties will, to the extent possible prior to such disclosure, in good faith meet to discuss and agree the form and content of that disclosure. </P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">&nbsp;</P>
<B><FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=4><P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI>Execution</LI></P></OL>
<DIR>
<DIR>

</B></FONT><P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">The parties agree that this agreement may be validly executed in multiple parts and that the reproduction of signatures by way of a telecopy or facsimile device will be treated as though such reproductions were executed originals and each party undertakes to provide the other with a copy of the agreement bearing original signatures within a reasonable time after execution thereof.</P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">&nbsp;</P></DIR>
</DIR>

<B><FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=4><P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">Executed as an agreement:</P>
</FONT><FONT FACE="Arial"><P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">Signed</B></FONT> by <B><FONT FACE="Arial">Dawn Robertson</P>
</B></FONT><P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">in the presence of:</P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">&#9;&#9;&#9;</P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">Witness</P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">&#9;</P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">Name (please print)</P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">&nbsp;</P>
<B><FONT FACE="Arial"><P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">Signed</B></FONT> for <B><FONT FACE="Arial">Coles Myer Ltd</P>
</B></FONT><P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">by its representative</P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">in the presence of:</P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">&#9;&#9;&#9;</P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">Witness&#9;Representative</P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">&#9;&#9;&#9;</P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">Name (please print)&#9;Name (please print)</P></BODY>

<FONT FACE="Arial"><P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">17 December 2002 </P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">Ms Dawn Robertson</P>
<P>Managing Director</P>
<P>Myer Grace Bros</P>
<P>295 Lonsdale Street</P>
<P>Melbourne Vic 3000</P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">Dear Dawn</P>
<B><P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">SHARE OPTIONS</P>
</B><P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">Following our discussions, this letter agreement confirms that the exercise price of the options offered under your Executive Service Agreement will be AUD$6.44, with the performance and eligibility period commencing 29 July 2002.</P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">As a result, clause 7.1 of your Executive Service Agreement is amended to read as follows:</P><DIR>
<DIR>

<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">"The Executive is offered 2.5 million Options under the Option Plan. The Options will:</P></DIR>
</DIR>

<OL TYPE="a">
<OL TYPE="a">

<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI>have an exercise price of AUD$6.44;</LI></P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI>have an Initial Test FY of the financial year of the Company commencing 29&nbsp;July 2002, notwithstanding the definition of Initial Test FY in the Option Plan."</LI></P></OL>
</OL>

<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">Consistent with the above changes and with the Option Certificate issued to you on 2 July 2002, the Invitation to Participate in the Options Issue dated 3 April 2002 is amended so that the reference to the exercise price of $7.66 and the explanation as to how it is calculated is superseded by a reference to the exercise price of $6.44.</P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">&nbsp;</P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">Yours sincerely&#9;</P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">&#9;</P>
<B><P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">John Fletcher&#9;</B>..................................</P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">Chief Executive Officer&#9;Date </P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">The terms set out above are agreed and accepted&#9;..........................................................</P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">Dawn Robertson</P></FONT></BODY>

<DESCRIPTION>EXECUTIVE CONTRACT A WILLIAMS
<TEXT>
<HTML>
<HEAD>
<META NAME="Generator" CONTENT="Microsoft Word 97">
<TITLE>Draft Management Contract Letter</TITLE>
<META NAME="subject" CONTENT="Draft Management Contract Letter">
<META NAME="FooterBUName" CONTENT="Freehills">
<META NAME="FooterDocID" CONTENT="003749996">
<META NAME="FooterLibraryName" CONTENT="Melbourne">
<META NAME="FooterReference" CONTENT="FIDOMEL1\003749996">

</HEAD>
<BODY LINK="#0000ff" VLINK="#800080">
<DIR>
<DIR>

<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">1 February 2002 </P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">Alan Williams</P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">Food Liquor &amp; Logistics Group</P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">Dear Alan,</P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">It is with pleasure that I write to confirm our offer of employment with Coles Myer Ltd ("the Company") on the following terms and conditions. While you are employed by the Company you may be required to work for the Company and/or any of its subsidiaries. Further, whilst you are an employee of the Company, your Total Fixed Compensation may be paid to you by the Company or one of its subsidiaries.</P></DIR>
</DIR>

<OL>
<OL>

<B><LI>Position</LI>
</B><P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">Your position will continue to be Chief Operating Officer Food, Liquor &amp; Logistics Group and this agreement shall commence as of 1&nbsp;February 2002. </P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">During your ongoing employment the Company may restructure its operations and management from time to time. Not-withstanding this, in making any such changes your Total Fixed Compensation entitlements will be maintained and the Company will take into consideration your skills and competencies. You should however be aware that such changes may include changes in title, role or reporting relationship within the Company or any of its subsidiaries. The Company will however discuss any proposed changes with you prior to them occurring.</P>
<B><P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">1.1&#9;Entire Agreement</P>
</B><P>This agreement supersedes all previous contracts, agreements and understandings in respect of your employment with the Company and any of its subsidiaries and embodies the entire agreement between yourself and the Company. </P>
<B><P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI>Remuneration Package</LI></P></OL>
</OL>
<DIR>
<DIR>

</B><P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">In accordance with the Company's Remuneration Policy, you will receive remuneration in the form of a Total Fixed Compensation package, which will be subject to annual review. However, your performance will be subject to ongoing review throughout the year.</P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">Your Total Fixed Compensation package will be $800,470 per annum. The elements included in your Total Fixed Compensation package are:</P></DIR>
</DIR>


<UL><DIR>
<DIR>
<DIR>
<DIR>


<UL>
<LI>Cash Salary </LI>
<LI>Superannuation </LI>
<LI>Vehicle (s)</LI></UL>
</DIR>
</DIR>
</DIR>
</DIR>
</UL>

<P>&nbsp;</P>
<OL TYPE="i">
<OL TYPE="i">

<B><LI>Cash Salary</LI>
</B><P>Subject to paragraph 2 (ii) you may elect the proportion of your Total Fixed Compensation to be taken as cash salary.</P>
<B><LI>Superannuation</LI>
</B><P>Your Total Fixed Compensation will continue to be adjusted to account for Superannuation. There will be deducted from your Total Fixed Compensation the notional cost, as determined by the Company from time to time, to the Company of providing your superannuation benefit in the Coles Myer Superannuation Fund.</P>
<P>You may also arrange with the Company to make additional voluntary contributions from your Total Fixed Compensation package on either a pre-tax or post-tax basis. Please contact your General Manager of Human Resources for further information, should you wish to make such arrangements.</P>
<B><LI>Vehicles</LI></OL>
</OL>
<DIR>
<DIR>
<DIR>
<DIR>

</B><P>In accordance with the Company's Vehicle Policy, you may elect to be allocated a vehicle (s). The cost of the vehicle (s) including finance, insurance, fuel, maintenance and FBT will form part of your Total Fixed Compensation package. Guidelines regarding the usage of vehicles will be provided to you.</P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">&nbsp;</P><DIR>
<DIR>
<DIR>
<DIR>
<DIR>
<DIR>

<B><P>3.&#9;Bonus Program&#9;</B>In this position, you are eligible to participate in the Company's Bonus Program which will vary from time to time depending upon Company policies and the needs of the business. Bonus payments will be determined at the discretion of the Company.</P>
<P>The current Bonus Program provides you with a possible annual bonus calculated as a percentage of your Total Fixed Compensation for the previous financial year. Such a bonus if payable, is also conditional on you remaining in an eligible position until 1 October following the 12 month assessment period ended 31 July.</P>
<P>You will be advised annually of your participation in any bonus program. This advice will include the bonus potential as well as details of the performance requirements.</P>
<B><P>4.&#9;Share Options&#9;</B>In this position you may be entitled to Share Options at the discretion of the Company, in line with rules of any Share Option Program as it applies from time to time. If you are entitled to Share Options, details of the relevant program will be discussed with you.</P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">&nbsp;</P></DIR>
</DIR>
</DIR>
</DIR>
</DIR>
</DIR>
</DIR>
</DIR>
</DIR>
</DIR>

<OL>
<OL>

<B><LI>Other Benefits</LI>
</B><P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">You will be entitled to the following additional benefits that may be varied from time to time in accordance with Company policy.</P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">Point of Sale Discount:&#9;You will continue to be entitled to the relevant Point of Sale discount as provided by Coles Myer Businesses. </P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">&#9;Executive Discount:&#9;&#9;You will continue to receive an additional 10% discount on Myer/Grace Bros purchases charged to your Coles Myer Ltd. Credit Card.</P>
<B><P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI>Location</LI></P>
</B><P>Your position location will be Tooronga.</P>
<P>However, dependent upon future Company operating requirements or promotional opportunities, the Company may require you, with reasonable notice, to alter your location, including possible intrastate relocation. Any possible interstate relocation will only occur with your mutual agreement. The Company will consult with you prior to any change occurring about the effects of such a change and provide you with relocation assistance in accordance with the Company's Relocation Policy.</P>
<B><P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI>Hours of Work</LI></P>
</B><P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">You are required to work a minimum of 40 hours per week. However, you are expected to work any additional hours that are necessary to perform your duties. Payment for any additional hours worked is included in your Total Fixed Compensation package.</P>
<B><P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI>Continuity of Service</LI></P>
</B><P>Your entitlement to your existing accruals of Sick, Annual and Long Service Leave will be maintained.</P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">If you were previously employed by one of the Company's subsidiaries, your accruals of Sick, Annual and Long Service Leave will be transferred. </P>
<B><LI>Leave</LI></OL>
</OL>
<DIR>
<DIR>

<P>9.1&#9;Annual Leave</P>
</B><P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">You will continue to be entitled to 20 working days paid annual leave upon each completed year of service. Annual leave can be taken at times mutually agreed between you and the Company within twelve months of your entitlement becoming due. However the Company may direct you to take your annual leave in cases where you and the Company are unable to reach an agreement on when leave should be taken. </P>
<P>&nbsp;</P></DIR>
</DIR>

<OL START=2>
<OL START=2>

<B><LI>Sick Leave</LI>
</B><P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">You will continue to be entitled to 8 days sick leave upon each completed year of service. All sick leave is cumulative but will not be paid out on termination of employment. </P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">At the Company's request, you may be required to provide medical certification as evidence of illness or injury for payment to be made.</P>
<B><P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI>Carer's Leave</LI></P>
</B><P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">You will continue to be entitled to Carer's Leave in accordance with Company policy as varied from time to time. The current policy provides up to 3 days per annum to care for members of your immediate family in times of illness. This leave does not accumulate from year to year. At the Company's request, you may be required to provide a medical certificate or statutory declaration to support this leave.</P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">&#9;</P>
<B><LI>Parental Leave</LI>
</B><P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">Parental leave means unpaid maternity, adoption or paternity leave. You are entitled to such leave in accordance with Company policy and legislative requirements.</P>
<B><P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI>Long Service Leave</LI></P></OL>
</OL>
<DIR>
<DIR>

</B><P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">Long Service Leave will accrue, and must be taken, in accordance with relevant legislation. However, Long Service Leave can be taken at times mutually agreed between you and the Company. The Company<B><I> </B></I>may direct you to take your accrued long service leave upon reasonable notice being given to you by the Company.</P></DIR>
</DIR>

<OL>
<OL>

<B><LI>Equal Employment Opportunity</LI>
</B><P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">The Company strives to provide all employees with<B> </B>equal employment opportunities. The Company's equal opportunity policy precludes discrimination and harassment based on, but not limited to, age, race, religion, sex, marital status, pregnancy, breast feeding, parental or carers status, political belief, industrial activity, sexual preference, gender identity and disability. You are required to familiarise yourself with the Company's equal opportunity policy and comply with it.</P>
<B><P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI>Occupational Health &amp; Safety</LI></P>
</B><P>You are required to perform your duties in a safe manner by observing all safe operating procedures notified to you by the Company and ensuring that you do not undertake any activity that may cause injury to yourself or your fellow employees.</P>
<P>You are required to familiarise yourself with the Company's policy on Occupational Health &amp; Safety and comply with it.</P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">&nbsp;</P>
<B><LI>Company Policies &amp; Procedures</LI>
</B><P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">You are required to comply with all Company policies and procedures as they apply now and in the future including any specific policy and procedure relating to any of its subsidiaries in which you may work. It will be your responsibility to acquaint yourself with Company policies and procedures, but should you ever be in doubt regarding such, you should seek advice from your manager. Whilst you are required to comply with Company policies, they do not form part of this agreement.</P>
<B><P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI>Conduct</LI></P>
</B><P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">The Company expects all its employees to behave in a manner appropriate for business purposes in the conduct of their duties. Expected standards of behaviour are detailed in the attached Company Code of Conduct booklet as amended from time to time. You are required to complete and return the Conflict of Interest Declaration form contained within the booklet.</P>
<B><P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI>Confidentiality, Intellectual Property</LI></P></OL>
</OL>
<DIR>
<DIR>

</B><P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">As part of this agreement, you are required to read, sign and return with your acceptance of this agreement, the attached Confidentiality Agreement.</P></DIR>
</DIR>

<OL START=15>

<B><P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI>Directorship </LI></P>
</B><P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">If as a consequence of carrying out your duties and responsibilities under this agreement you are appointed a director or other officer of any entity (whether or not related to the Company within the meaning of the Corporations Act) or hold any property (including without limitation shares or units in a trust) on trust for the Company or any of its related entities, then upon cessation of your employment with the Company you will, unless otherwise directed by the Company, immediately resign from such appointment and transfer and deliver to the Company or at the Company's direction destroy such property, as the case may be. You irrevocably appoint the Company Secretary of the Company or any other person nominated by the Company as your attorney to sign on your behalf all documents necessary to effect the resignation and transfer and delivery.</P>
<B><LI>Termination</LI></OL>
<DIR>
<DIR>

</B><P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">The Company may terminate your employment at any time by providing you with 12 months notice or the payment in lieu thereof. Should you intend to resign, you are required to provide the Company with 6 months notice. Should you or the Company provide such notice the Company may direct you to perform only such duties as it determines to be appropriate. A lesser period of notice may apply by mutual agreement. Any payment in lieu of notice will be based on your Total Fixed Compensation package. </P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">The Company may terminate your employment without notice in circumstances warranting summary dismissal. Such circumstances would include, but not be limited to:</P></DIR>
</DIR>

<OL TYPE="a">
<OL TYPE="a">

<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI>you committing any act of dishonesty, fraud, misconduct, wilful breach of duty or Company policy, or serious and wilful neglect in the performance of your duties; or</LI></P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI VALUE=1>you being convicted for an offence precluding or inhibiting the further performance of your duties. </LI></P></OL>
</OL>

<OL START=15>

<B><P ALIGN="JUSTIFY"><LI>Restraint </LI></P></OL>
<DIR>
<DIR>

</B><P>In executing this agreement you covenant and agree that you shall not during your employment or for a 12 month period thereafter on behalf of yourself or another person, company or organisation;</P></DIR>
</DIR>

<OL TYPE="a">

<LI>Solicit or persuade any person you have dealt with on behalf of the Company or any of its subsidiaries during the last 12 months of your employment or is in the process of negotiating with the Company, to cease doing business with the Company or any subsidiary or reduce the amount of business which the person would normally do with the Company or any subsidiary. </LI>
<LI>Induce or attempt to induce any director, manager or employee of the Company or any subsidiary to terminate his or her employment with the Company or any subsidiary, whether or not that person would commit a breach of that person's contract of employment. </LI>
<LI>Employ or engage in any capacity any person who has been a director, manager, employee of or consultant to the Company or any subsidiary during your employment who is or may be likely to be in possession of any confidential information or trade secrets relating to the business of the Company or any subsidiary.</LI>
<LI>Participate, promote, assist, consult, advise or otherwise be directly or indirectly concerned with or involved in, financially or otherwise, as a director, consultant, adviser, principal, agent, manager, employee, beneficiary, partner or associate in any general merchandise or apparel retailing business with sales turnover of greater than $1Billion, or any food or liquor retailing business with sales turnover of greater than $1Billion, anywhere in Australia, other than a business owned or operated by the Company or a subsidiary.</LI>
<LI>Without in anyway resiling from this restraint you should be aware that upon termination the Company would be prepared to consider a waiver or limitation of these obligations depending upon the circumstances at the time. This is not to suggest a waiver or limitation would be automatic but employees are encouraged to raise this issue upon termination. Any waiver or limitation of these obligations must be authorised in writing by the Group General Manager of Human Resources.</LI></OL>

<OL START=15>

<B><LI>Restraints reasonable</LI></OL>
<DIR>
<DIR>

</B><P>&#9;You and the Company consider the restraints contained in this clause to be reasonable and intend the restraints to operate to the maximum extent.</P>
<P>&#9;If these restraints:</P></DIR>
</DIR>

<OL TYPE="a">
<OL TYPE="a">

<LI>are void as unreasonable for the protection of the interests of the Company; and</LI>
<LI>would be valid if part of the wording was deleted or the period or area was reduced.</LI></OL>
</OL>
<DIR>
<DIR>

<P>&#9;the restraints will apply with the modifications necessary to make them effective.</P></DIR>
</DIR>

<OL START=15>

<B><LI>Restraints independent</LI></OL>
<DIR>
<DIR>

<P>&#9;</B>The restraints contained within the separate paragraphs of this clause are separate, distinct and severable, so that the unenforceability of any restraint does not affect the enforceability of the other restraints.</P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">&nbsp;</P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">To accept this offer, you must sign and return this agreement within seven days. A copy of this agreement has also been enclosed for your records. Should you require clarification or any further information, please do not hesitate to contact me. </P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">In conclusion, I look forward to continuing to work with you in a productive and rewarding association.</P>
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">Yours sincerely</P>
<B><P>JOHN FLETCHER</P></DIR>
</DIR>
</B></BODY>
</HTML>

</TEXT>
